SENT.plain: A 32-year-old white woman presented with persistent swelling of the right upper eyelid for diagnosis and therapy
History and physical examination revealed a faint nevus flammeus on the right side of her face and neck and bilateral blepharochalasis, both of which can produce unilateral periorbital swelling
A biopsy taken for histology was diagnostic in this case, since it showed lymphoedema secondary to lymphangiectasias associated with the patient's port-wine stain
Many other possible causes of unilateral lid swelling have to be considered and excluded before a definite diagnosis can be established
